comments.body: This isn't true, is it? The "For safety" sentence- because it's basically "alias is required.. unless not, which is okay".

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +36,40 @@    description: An alias for a key. For safety, even though KMS does not require keys
      to have an alias, this module expects all new keys to be given an alias
      to make them easier to manage. Existing keys without an alias may be
      referred to by I(key_id). Use M(aws_kms_facts) to find key ids. Required
      if I(key_id) is not given. Note that passing a I(key_id) and I(alias)

comments.body: `policy` should be added to `argument_spec` to be usable.
This changes the return message of this function. It's a bit more accurate, but may be worth noting in a changelog in case folks are asserting on msg.
This was pre-existing to your changes (and it looks like you've fixed a bunch of check mode bugs here already, thanks!), but it looks like deletion is scheduled regardless of check mode.
Sure I'll get that fixed in this pull.  This pull's major enough surgery to start with.
This function doesn't take check_mode into account

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +783,787 @@    changed = False

    changed |= cancel_key_deletion(connection, module, key)
    changed |= ensure_enabled_disabled(connection, module, key, module.params['enabled'])
    changed |= update_alias(connection, module, key, module.params['alias'])
